oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Smokey Smith show (KRNT) - 1952-08 transcriptions - Part 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 3 of transcriptions for delayed playback featuring Smokey Smith, to be used for his KRNT (Des Moines, IA) radio program for the date of 1952-08-04 and likely other August 1952 broadcasts. Smokey announces that he is to appear at the Jasper County Fair in Colfax, IA on 1952-08-13. The discs's original sleeve states that Iowa Rose was composed by Smokey himself.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Smokey Smith
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: My Life's Been A Pleasure -- By The River Of The Roses (bad cut) -- By The River Of The Roses -- Keep Them Cold Icy Fingers Off Of Me -- I'm A Fool To Care -- Teardrops In My Heart -- Announcement of upcoming appearance
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: KRNT (Radio station : Des Moines, Iowa); Smith, Smokey, 1922-;
